meanings.sent1: My sister is my antipole, always wanting to go out while I prefer staying in.
meanings.sent2: The villain in the movie was the antipole of the hero, causing chaos wherever he went.
meanings.sent3: In a funny twist, the cat and dog seemed to switch roles, with the cat becoming the antipole of the usual troublemaker.
meanings.sent4: Her cheerful demeanor was the antipole to his gloomy outlook on life.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful garden was the antipole of the noisy city streets.

meanings.definition: A point directly opposite another point on the earth's surface.
meanings.sent1: The antipole of our location on the globe is a remote island in the Pacific Ocean.
meanings.sent2: When you dig a hole straight through the Earth, you end up at the antipole of your starting point.
meanings.sent3: The treasure map led them to the antipole of the old oak tree, where they found a hidden chest.
meanings.sent4: The antipole of the North Pole is the South Pole, creating a balance in the Earth's magnetic field.
meanings.sent5: The antipole of the equator is the imaginary line that divides the Earth into the Northern and Southern Hemispheres.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is the exact opposite of another.
meanings.sent1: He was the antipole of his twin brother, always calm and collected while his brother was energetic and spontaneous.
meanings.sent2: The black swan was considered the antipole of the white swan, symbolizing contrast and duality.
meanings.sent3: The tiny seed grew into a towering tree, becoming the antipole of its humble beginnings.
meanings.sent4: Her love for adventure was the antipole of his fear of the unknown.
meanings.sent5: The bright morning sun was the antipole of the dark night sky.
